meanings.definition: Direct or guide (something) through a canal.
meanings.sent1: The workers canalized the water to irrigate the fields.
meanings.sent2: The engineers canalized the river to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent3: The ducks canalized their way through the narrow waterway.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were canalized towards finding a solution.
meanings.sent5: The teacher canalized the students' energy into a productive project.

meanings.definition: Restrict or confine (something) to a particular course or direction.
meanings.sent1: The rules canalized the discussion to stay on topic.
meanings.sent2: The barriers canalized the crowd towards the exit.
meanings.sent3: The maze canalized the participants into different paths.
meanings.sent4: His fear canalized his actions, making him cautious.
meanings.sent5: The boundaries canalized the traffic flow efficiently.
